books.title: The Thirty-Nine Steps
books.author: John Buchan
books.summary: An expatriate returning to England after many years in South Africa is accused of a murder he did not commit, and has to flee from the police and other more dangerous pursuers.

books.title: Sir Percy Hits Back
books.author: Baroness Orczy
books.summary: A young woman doing a good deed is inadvertently caught up in the injustice of the French Revolution.

books.title: Elizabeth and Her German Garden
books.author: Elizabeth von Arnim
books.summary: The English wife of a German aristocrat recounts, through a series of diary entries, a year spent revitalizing the neglected garden of their estate.

books.title: Personal Recollections of Joan of Arc
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: A fictional biography of Joan of Arc from her early teenage years to her martyrdom.

books.title: The Wonderful Adventures of Nils
books.author: Selma Lagerlöf
books.summary: Nils Holgersson, transformed to an elf, learns the meaning of kindness during his adventures with a flock of wild geese.

books.title: Penguin Island
books.author: Anatole France
books.summary: A myopic saint mistakenly baptizes some penguins, ushering in a centuries-spanning satire of French history.

books.title: The Hairy Ape
books.author: Eugene O’Neill
books.summary: An expressionist play following a brutish stoker’s dehumanization as he descends from being a leader of his fellow workers to a literal ape.

books.title: Kai Lung’s Golden Hours
books.author: Ernest Bramah
books.summary: An ancient Chinese storyteller charged with treason uses his beguiling tales to avoid conviction.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.summary: A collection of short fiction by F. Scott Fitzgerald, ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Edgar Allan Poe
books.summary: A collection of Edgar Allan Poe’s short fiction, ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Up from Slavery
books.author: Booker T. Washington
books.summary: The autobiography of Booker T. Washington, former slave and founder of the Tuskegee Institute.

books.title: The Dain Curse
books.author: Dashiell Hammett
books.summary: A detective assigned to investigate a diamond theft finds himself entangled by a family curse.

books.title: Table-Talk
books.author: William Hazlitt
books.summary: A collection of essays on art, literature, philosophy, society, and culture.

books.title: Democracy and Social Ethics
books.author: Jane Addams
books.summary: Jane Addams argues that addressing social issues like poverty and inequality requires shifting from individual morality to a collective understanding of social responsibility.

books.title: New Hampshire
books.author: Robert Frost
books.summary: Robert Frost’s Pulitzer-winning book of poetry.

books.title: A Woman of No Importance
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.summary: A mother’s secretive past clashes with high society when her son is offered an irresistible position with a charismatic nobleman.

books.title: Armageddon 2419 A.D.
books.author: Philip Francis Nowlan
books.summary: Adventure hero Buck Rogers battles the forces of the evil Han Empire in 2419 America.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Philip K. Dick
books.summary: A collection of short works by science fiction legend Philip K. Dick.

books.title: The Path to Rome
books.author: Hilaire Belloc
books.summary: Hilaire Belloc takes a walking pilgrimage to Rome from his hometown in France, writing of the journey, sketching the sights, and digressing on a wide variety of subjects.

books.title: To Cuba and Back
books.author: Richard Henry Dana Jr.
books.summary: A captivating travel memoir recounting an 1859 journey to Cuba, offering vivid descriptions of the island’s culture, landscapes, and people.
